channel.title: Workaround on Biocozy.net
channel.description: Recent content in Workaround on Biocozy.net

item.title: Another workaround for Memory Issues in R / Bioconductor
item.description: This post could be entitled “Error: cannot allocate vector of size 256.0 Mb”. R provides this maddening response for even the most trivial seeming tasks. I have a 4 Gb linux system, and I have encountered this error message for “vector of size” in the 10s of Mb. And system wide, there appears to be plenty of memory still available, and the swap space hasn’t been touched. What’s going on with R memory management?
